DataElement.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Diagnosis Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to questions which are necessary to allow a person to participate in a clinical study related to the diagnosis of any abnormal condition of the body or mind as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Diagnosis Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A disease is any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. Sometimes the term is used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function. (from Wikipedia)

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ObjectClass.changeDescription: Updated to add EVS concept preferred name. dw

Property.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/17/17 tt released for reuse. 3/9/17 TT, EA1151.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has the patient ever been dia
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient ever been diagnosed with endometriosis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CE7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a primary germ cell tumour, small cell carcinoma, or lymphoma?

ReferenceDocuments.name: EAE161
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have carcinosarcoma, non-epithelial, low grade tumors, or tumors with low malignant potential?

ReferenceDocuments.name: EAQ171CD
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any type of cancer diagnosed within the past 4 months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: WF1805CD
ReferenceDocuments.description: Diagnosis of primary or locoregionally recurrent head and neck squamous cell carcinoma, specifically oral cavity, larynx, oropharynx, hypopharynx, and unknown squamous cell carcinoma primary.

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have oral cavity cancer, nasopharynx cancer, or p16-negative cancer of unknown primary (CUP)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Diagnosis of primary or loco-regionally recurrent head and neck squamous cell carcinoma, specifically oral cavity, larynx, any part of pharynx and unknown squamous cell carcinoma primary.
ReferenceDocuments.description: Diagnosis of primary or loco-regionally recurrent head and neck squamous cell carcinoma, specifically oral cavity, larynx, any part of pharynx and unknown squamous cell carcinoma primary.

ReferenceDocuments.name: URCC22063
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have a primary diagnosis of unresectable or Stage IV 1) non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC), 2) pancreatic adenocarcinoma, or 3) colorectal cancer.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have clinically significant cardiac dysfunction, uncontrolled, significant tumor lysis syndrome, serum creatinine greater than 2 times ULN, and acute neurological toxicity that would impact the investigator's ability to evaluate induced neurotoxicity?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG-ACRIN - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have retroperitoneal or mesenteric/abdominal sarcoma?
